availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert M. Davis (Mercer County, Kentucky farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Sarah A. Davis. Father of Jerusha M. Davis, Crittenden Davis, Kittie Davis, Sallie Davis, and Walter Davis. Commissioner of Company to turnpike a road from Harrodsburg, Kentucky, to Cane Run Meeting House in 1849. Member of the Board of Directors of Harrodsburg Savings Institution. Owned twenty-seven enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 62.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 19.
Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky Passed at the December Session, 1848 (Frankfort, KY: A.G. Hodges and Co., State Printers, 1849), 443.
KYR-0002-225-0043.
Find A Grave, "Robert M. Davis (1806-1874)," Memorial #100143685, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100143685/robert-m.-davis (Accessed April 24, 2018).
